required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: KARMA Kontrast - a Controlled Trial Evaluating Contrast Enhanced Mammography in Early Detection of Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: KARMA Kontrast - a Controlled Trial Evaluating Contrast Enhanced Mammography in Early Detection of Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Women taking part in the National Mammography Screening Program, examined at Södersjukhuset Breast Centre at Södra station in Stockholm and recalled because of suspicion of breast cancer will be invited to participate. A Contrast Enhanced Mammography will be added to the standard of care procedures for investigating a suspicion of breast cancer and blinded from each other 2 radiologists will evaluate either the Contrast Enhanced Mammography or the standard of care examinations. When comparing the potentially extra findings with Contrast Enhanced Mammography will be calculated. Potential side effects together with the patient experience will also be evaluated.

study_design_info.masking_description: The added Contrast Enhanced Mammography will be evaluated by a radiologist blinded from the radiologists evaluating the standard of care examinations.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluating sensitivity of Contrast Enhanced Mammography in detecting multifocality and/or contralateral breast cancer, compared to standard breast radiology work-up methods.

secondary_outcome.description: Estimate the specificity of Contrast Enhanced Mammography in detecting absence of breast cancer, compared to standard breast radiology work-up methods.

Evaluate the safety of using Contrast Enhanced Mammography, based on adverse event reporting. Potential adverse event will be collected, reported and, if necessary, intervened, on the day for the Contrast Enhanced Mammography and up to 30 days after. All adverse events will be put in to the eCRF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient acceptance of Contrast Enhanced Mammography
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the acceptance in patients, based on a questionnaire at the end of the study visit and structured telephone interviews 1-2 weeks after. The answers to the questionnaire is on a 5-grade scale. The interviews will go deeper and summaries of the answers will be put in to the eCRF.
Comparing Contrast Enhanced Mammography with each standard breast radiology work-up method for tumor size assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mammographic density influence on the performance of Contrast Enhanced Mammography
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate if mammographic density influences the performance of Contrast Enhanced Mammography compared to standard breast radiology work-up methods.
Calculate the costs for using Contrast Enhanced Mammography

arm_group.description: All included women go through a Contrast Enhanced Mammography added to the standard of care examinations.

intervention.description: A modality for examining breast conditions which is already approved and used but the evaluation of its role in a recalled screening population is limited. Intravenous iodine contrast is given prior to the mammogram.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Age: >40 - <64 years
- Recalled after Mx screening based on abnormal mammographic findings
- The woman has read, understood and signed the Informed Consent Form (ICF)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous breast cancer
- A breast biopsy performed within 6 weeks preceding the study
- Recent exposure (during the last week) to iodine contrast media.
- Pregnancy
- Current breast feeding
- Diagnosed with a pheochromocytoma or a paraganglioma
- Diagnosed with myeloma or other malignant plasma cell disease
- Diagnosed with myasthenia gravis
- A renal failure or kidney disorder with increased risk for developing renal failure (single kidney or kidney transplanted)
- Diabetes (other than dietary treated)
- Heart failure or liver failure
- Intake of potentially nephrotoxic substances (daily intake of NSAID, nephrotoxic antibiotics or nephrotoxic chemotherapy)
- Iodine contrast allergy
- Uncontrolled thyrotoxicosis
- A history of severe allergy
- Subjects unable to read, understand and execute written informed consent
- Any medical aspect that, according to the investigator, could jeopardize the health of the participant
